cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
G.T.5826
SECRET
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 29th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
WESTERN FRONT.
BRITISH FRONT.
On the YPRES Battle Front, the advance of the Belgians and British continues, and the former are reported to have advanced as far as ZARREN (F. of DIXMUDE) and MOORSLEDE (N.E. of ZONNEBEKE). DADIZEELE has been taken by the British.
The general line now runs as follows:- DIXMUDE - ZARREN - ? - E. of WESTROOSBEKE and PASSCHENDAELE - MOORSLEDE - ? - DADIZEELE - KRUISEECKE - HOUTHEM - E. of MESSINES.
On the CAMBRAI Battle Front. South and North of CAMBRAI our troops continue to make progress and are reported to be nearing the Northern oustskirts of the town. BLECOURT (N. of CAMBRAI) has been also reported to hold the BONAVIS SPUR (E. of LA VACQUERIE).
On the ST. QUENTIN Battle Front, it is understood our advance is going well, but no details have been received.
FRENCH FRONT.
South of ST.QUENTIN the French are also making progress towards URVILLERS.
Between the AISNE and the AILETTE further progress has been made and the French have captured the FOREST OF PINON and border the Canal in this region as far as CHAVIGNON.
MACEDONIAN FRONT.
The pursuit of the enemy by Anglo-Greek troops is continuing eastwards along the STRUMNITZA VALLEY and Northwards from STRUMNITZA. The total of guns captured by Anglo-Greek force is between 60 and 80.
The Serbians have occupied CAREVO SELU and are advancing on PESCHEVO, DSUMAJA and northwards.
ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
Nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
29th September, 1918.
Issued at 6.30 p.m.
